sentences.en: "Maybe we could celebrate tonight." — "What did you have in mind?"
sentences.cn: “也许今晚我们可以庆祝一下。”——“你有何打算？”

sentences.en: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Christ from the death.
sentences.cn: 基督教徒们庆祝耶稣基督的复活.

sentences.en: He returned home each year to celebrate Christmas and New Year with his family.
sentences.cn: 他每年都回家和家人一起欢度圣诞和新年。

sentences.en: He was in no mood to celebrate.
Holmgren is careful not to celebrate prematurely.
sentences.cn: 霍姆格伦非常小心，以免庆祝得过早了。

sentences.en: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.cn: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.en: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.cn: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.en: People come from everywhere to celebrate the victory.
sentences.cn: 人们从各处来庆祝胜利.

sentences.en: poems that celebrate the joys of love

sentences.cn: 苏格兰的冠军庆祝胜利！

sentences.en: The banks have had precious little to celebrate recently.
sentences.cn: 银行最近没几件值得庆贺的事。

sentences.en: The club will celebrate its centenary next year.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部明年要庆祝成立一百周年。

sentences.en: The whole city will celebrate the New Year with fireworks.
sentences.cn: 今年过年,全城都将放焰火.

sentences.en: They celebrate their wedding anniversary annually.
sentences.cn: 他们每年庆祝一番结婚纪念日.

sentences.en: They had a family feast to celebrate it.
sentences.cn: 他们举办家宴,以示庆贺.

sentences.en: They were singing and dancing to celebrate this joyful occasion.
sentences.cn: 他们唱着、跳着庆祝这令人欢乐的时刻.

sentences.en: to celebrate the quatercentenary of Shakespeare's birth
sentences.cn: 庆祝莎士比亚诞辰400周年

sentences.en: We hope to give fans something to celebrate this season.
sentences.cn: 我们希望在本赛季能给球迷一些值得庆祝的事。

sentences.en: We like to identify and celebrate women's success whenever we come across it.
sentences.cn: 每当女性取得成功，我们都会表示认同并予以颂扬。

words.tran_cn: 司仪神父；主持仪式的人；主持弥撒的教父
庆祝（celebrate的过去式和过去分词）
庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

trans.tran_cn: 庆祝，赞美，主持（圣餐或弥撒）
trans.tran_en: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable
